title: After Alex Pretti's death in Minneapolis, Trump's strategy of tension comes under scrutiny
subhead: The American president has tried to persuade public opinion that Democrats and protesters were to blame for the violence caused by his immigration policy. The largest city in Minnesota, where federal agents killed a second person on Saturday, has become his testing ground.

title: Peter Thiel comes to Paris to speak about the Antichrist
Former British home secretary Braverman joins far-right party Reform UK
Gabriel Attal pushes ahead with presidential bid, despite doubts within party
subhead: Criticized internally for his political positioning and strategy, the former French prime minister rejects comparisons with his longtime mentor, Emmanuel Macron.

title: China accuses top general of having sought to undermine Xi's authority
subhead: The Chinese Communist Party has launched an investigation into Zhang Youxia, 75, first vice chairman of the Central Military Commission, for 'serious violations of discipline and law.' His downfall raises profound questions about loyalty and stability within the world's second most powerful military.

title: Is it ever a good idea to... wear ultra-wide trousers?
subhead: In fashion, as in life, it is important to know the lines you should not cross. Or else, to do so deliberately.

title: Eiffel Tower to honor 72 women scientists for posterity
subhead: On Monday, a multidisciplinary commission presented the mayor of Paris with a list of 72 names of women who will join the exclusively male scientists whose names are inscribed on the frieze of the 'Iron Lady.'

title: French rights ombudsman condemns use of weapons to stop migrants crossing Channel

Venezuela: More than 100 political prisoners freed
Paris Men's Fashion Week: Véronique Nichanian delivers final lesson in elegance at Hermès
Myanmar pro-junta party claims victory in elections denounced by UN

Russia steps up attacks on Ukraine's shipping routes in the Black Sea
France is considering banning phones in high schools. This school near Paris already does.
subhead: The Lycée Michelet, a large school complex with 2,300 students, banned mobile phones in its hallways in April 2025. School officials report positive results from a decision made in agreement with the entire educational community.

title: 'We were walking in blood': Iran's doctors recount crackdown on protesters
subhead: From crowded emergency rooms to apocalyptic scenes in Iranian cities, healthcare workers told Le Monde about the violence that descended on protesters calling for the end of the Iranian regime from January 8.

title: Generative AI, psychiatry and the risks of self-service therapy
subhead: Millions of people use chatbots like ChatGPT to share their distress, and the scientific community has warned about the risks vulnerable people face. Generative AI has shaken up psychiatric consultations, fueled tech giants' ambitions and emerged as a credible tool for analyzing pathologies.

title: Immigration: Trump's dangerous strategy of tension
The EU's emancipation from the US requires clarity and resolve
'As it ceases to inspire, the US is losing part of itself'
